title: How to Crochet a Stan Marsh (from South Park) Hat

steps.headline: First, learn how to crochet so you can understand what I'm saying.
Then get some blue yarn and red yarn and a size F hook.
steps.description: We will start with the blue yarn.

steps.headline: Start off by making a slipknot and chaining 6, then join them together using the slip stitch.
Then do 10 single crochet inside the circle, DO NOT JOIN AT THE END.
steps.description: You will have a total of 10 stitches in the circle.

steps.headline: Do 2 single crochet per stitch for a total of 20 stitches.
Do 2 more single crochet per stitch for a total of 40 stitches.
Then do 2 more single crochet per stitch for a total of 80 stitches.
Then for rows 5 through about 16, do a double crochet per stitch, but do not join at all.
After row 15 switch on to the red string and keep double crocheting until row 21.
Then end off, but try not to make it noticeable.
steps.description: How I do it is I do 20 double crochet, then 20 half double crochet, then 20 single crochet, then 20 slip stitches—this will be row 22.

steps.headline: Then make his red pom pom by making a doughnut shape template, then start wrapping the yarn through the outside and the hole in the middle.
steps.description: MAKE SURE THE TEMPLATE IS DOUBLED LAYERED.

steps.headline: Then after you can't string anymore, tie it off towards the circle in the middle.
steps.description: Get a 12-inch string; cut the strings towards the top of the doughnut (not the middle). Then split the doubled layered template and tie the string as tight as you can.

steps.headline: Rip off the paper and you should have a pom pom.
Put the pom pom through the hole or by the hole and tie it on.
Then cut the loose ends of the yarn in the pom pom.
Weave in the loose ends on the pom pom

text: First, learn how to crochet so you can understand what I'm saying.  Then get some blue yarn and red yarn and a size F hook. We will start with the blue yarn. Start off by making a slipknot and chaining 6, then join them together using the slip stitch.  Then do 10 single crochet inside the circle, DO NOT JOIN AT THE END. You will have a total of 10 stitches in the circle. Do 2 single crochet per stitch for a total of 20 stitches.  Do 2 more single crochet per stitch for a total of 40 stitches.  Then do 2 more single crochet per stitch for a total of 80 stitches.  Then for rows 5 through about 16, do a double crochet per stitch, but do not join at all.  After row 15 switch on to the red string and keep double crocheting until row 21.  Then end off, but try not to make it noticeable. How I do it is I do 20 double crochet, then 20 half double crochet, then 20 single crochet, then 20 slip stitches—this will be row 22. Then make his red pom pom by making a doughnut shape template, then start wrapping the yarn through the outside and the hole in the middle. MAKE SURE THE TEMPLATE IS DOUBLED LAYERED. Then after you can't string anymore, tie it off towards the circle in the middle. Get a 12-inch string; cut the strings towards the top of the doughnut (not the middle). Then split the doubled layered template and tie the string as tight as you can. Rip off the paper and you should have a pom pom.  Put the pom pom through the hole or by the hole and tie it on.  Then cut the loose ends of the yarn in the pom pom.  Weave in the loose ends on the pom pom
